doc.title: Slug

value.content:
A Slug is the unique identifying part of a web address, typically at the end of the URL. In the context of MDN, it is the portion of the URL following "<locale>/docs/".

It may also just be the final component when a new document is created under a parent document; for example, this page's slug is Glossary/Slug .

doc.summary: A Slug is the unique identifying part of a web address, typically at the end of the URL. In the context of MDN, it is the portion of the URL following "<locale>/docs/".
